Text.Value: What are you talking- gods, no!
If you hadn't been there -
Path to Moonrise is opening up. Time for vengeance.

EditorData.NodeContext: bitter, preparing for battle but it's become personal

Text.Value: There is no better death than to fall in battle. You should be happy for him!
Dead, is he? Maybe if he'd spent less time joking, he'd still be around.
He always took such good care of this... I'll do the same. For him.
If you lose yourself to grief we will fall before the true battle begins. Harden your heart.
We need to end this quickly - before the shadows break through again.
I don't care what you say, so long as you pay.
I'm sure he knew. I'm sure he cared for you as well.
*Sniffle.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Has been crying - wipes away tear
EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet.

Text.Value: I - I'd like to be alone.

EditorData.NodeContext: Cold response to "you'll get over it"

Text.Value: It's a dangerous life, being a soldier.
He was a good Harper. A good friend...

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Turns to face player after finishing this line

EditorData.stateContext: Back to player. Standing in front of the altar

Text.Value: ...too late now.
I think I need some time by myself now.

EditorData.NodeContext: After line she turns away from the player, as she brushes away tears.

Text.Value: He was joking, this morning. Yonas, I mean.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Player] walks up to stand behind Meygan <TarikS>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The player walks up to stand behind Meygan, but she doesn't look at them.
EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet.

Text.Value: What is wrong with you? Just... leave me be.
No, he... Sorry, I - I'd like to be alone.
Thank you. You're a good person.
At the ready.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Siege is over, but Haven doesn't have any protection anymore.

Text.Value: I hope so. They're all I have to give.
There was an ambush in the dark. The shadows dragged him away...
Better at jokes than keeping himself alive, I hope.
Sounds like you were close.
Make them hurt, yeah?

EditorData.NodeContext: bitter, preparing for battle but it's become personal

Text.Value: We were. Comrades in arms.
I'm sorry, I'd like to be alone.
You must know better than any of us - we've got to get into the Towers. Now.
Don't lose yourself in grief - many more will fall in battles to come.
They're here. More of those things that killed Yonas. I won't let them take anyone else.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Isobel is gone and Shadow Creatures are sieging the Haven. Some NPCs are in the basement.

Text.Value: *Stifled sobs.*

EditorData.NodeContext: Meygan stares into space for a few beats, fighting back tears. She steels herself and turns to face the player

Text.Value: Hey - it will be all right.
He was always joking. Said it was good for morale, but he just liked seeing people laugh.
Give her time to speak.
I'm so sorry for your loss.
Got nothing to give you for it. Just... leave me be.
Why would that make me happy? Sorry, I - I'd like to be alone.

EditorData.NodeContext: horrified, Chokes up a little. Swallows back her tears.

Text.Value: All the more reason to mourn the ones we lose.
Give her the sword.
I should thank you... take this.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Meygan]  takes object from inventory behind back and hands it to player.<TarikS>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Meygan takes object from inventory behind back and hands it to player.

Text.Value: I'd rather die myself than see another Harper taken.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Isobel is gone and Shadow Creatures are sieging the Haven. Some NPCs are in the basement.

Text.Value: Kidding - I'm keeping it.
I... yes, I'd like that. I don't know what to say.
I don't know. And I never will.
Leave.
I thought we could have been something more, one day, but...

EditorData.NodeContext: Chokes up a little. Swallows back her tears.

Text.Value: ...Leave.

EditorData.NodeContext: She purses her lips, fighting back despair, anger and tears. She can barely speak.

Text.Value: Smart. Bit of levity before a daunting battle never hurt.
Is he... gone?
Here. Take it and leave me be.
You'll get over it.
It doesn't have to be too late.
I found his sword on his body. Would you like to have it?
Thought you were doing me a kindness. Stupid of me.

EditorData.NodeContext: Tone hardening against the player's sudden mercenary streak.

Text.Value: Humour helps on a hunt - it can be the spark when all hope is lost.
Sorry, I - I don't think I can talk right now.
I don't care what it takes; this place will not fall.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Siege is over, but Haven doesn't have any protection anymore.

Text.Value: He died in battle - his valiant soul will heed your prayers.
Keep lending his soul your prayers. The Triad listens. Always.
Your prayers will honour his immortal soul - wherever it is.
I'm sure he'd appreciate your prayers.

Synopsis: Dialogue with Meygan in Last Light. She is standing before an altar, mourning Yonas' death. She might give us something if we give her his sword. Despite changes in the state of the grove, she usually reverts to her normal dialogue/ state of sadness as she was close to Yonas and that's more to the front of her mind than stuff like Ketheric
